front_page_data.name: Rath Yatra
front_page_data.description: A vibrant chariot festival in June/July at the Jagannath Temple, with decorated chariots, devotional songs, and Odissi dance.

front_page_data.name: Durga Puja & Kali Puja
front_page_data.description: Held in October/November at Dakhinakali Temple, with pandals, Gotipua dance, and processions honoring Goddesses Durga and Kali.

front_page_data.name: Makara Mela
front_page_data.description: Celebrated during Makara Sankranti (January) at Singhanath Temple, featuring rituals, music, dance, and stalls with crafts and food.
front_page_data.highlight: January, Mahanadi River island near T-Setu

front_page_data.name: Chhena Poda
front_page_data.description: A roasted cottage cheese dessert with a caramelized flavor, popular during festivals and celebrations.

specific_page_data.name: Rath Yatra

specific_page_data.name: Pakhala Bhata
specific_page_data.description: Fermented rice served with curd, vegetables, or fish curry, a cooling staple enjoyed especially in summer.

specific_page_data.name: Chhena Poda
specific_page_data.description: A roasted cottage cheese dessert with a caramelized flavor, popular during festivals and celebrations.

specific_page_data.name: Sambalpuri Sarees
specific_page_data.description: Intricate ikat-woven sarees in vibrant colors, worn by women during festivals and ceremonies.

specific_page_data.name: Dhokra Art
specific_page_data.description: Tribal metal-casting craft using lost-wax technique, creating figurines and jewelry sold in markets and festivals.

specific_page_data.name: Pattachitra
specific_page_data.description: Traditional scroll paintings depicting mythological stories, crafted by artisans in nearby villages.

specific_page_data.name: Odissi & Gotipua Dance
specific_page_data.description: Classical Odissi and traditional Gotipua dances performed during festivals, narrating divine stories with graceful movements.
